ai-ud4.9:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
ai-ud4.9:1.3_0: Then as Venerable Upasena Vaṅgantaputta was in private retreat this thought came to his mind:
ai-ud4.9:1.4_0: “I’m so fortunate, so very fortunate! My Teacher is the Blessed One, perfected, a fully awakened Buddha.
ai-ud4.9:1.5_0: Well explained is the teaching and training in which I have gone forth from the lay life to homelessness.
ai-ud4.9:1.6_0: My spiritual companions are ethical and of good character.
ai-ud4.9:1.8_0: My mind is unified and serene.
ai-ud4.9:1.9_0: I am perfected, my defilements ended.
ai-ud4.9:1.10_0: I am of great might and power.
ai-ud4.9:1.11_0: My life has been good, and my death will be good.”
ai-ud4.9:2.1_0: Then, knowing what that Venerable Upasena was thinking, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud4.9:3.1_0: “One who has no guilt in life,
ai-ud4.9:3.3_0: that wise one who has seen the truth,
ai-ud4.9:4.1_0: For the mendicant with peaceful mind,
ai-ud4.9:4.4_0: there are no future lives for them.”
